alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:15PM EST until January 30 at 4:37PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oglethorpe and Oconee Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 13.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/29/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 815 AM EST.
